metadata.title: CVE-2021-29945 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The WebAssembly JIT could miscalculate the size of a return type, whichcould lead to a null read and result in a crash. *Note: This issue onlyaffected x86-32 platforms. Other platforms are unaffected.*. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox< 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
